poem:
**Eurovision Reverie**

Amidst glitter and glam's bold embrace,  
tongues twist in cheeky verse,  
beneath the spotlight's feverish race.  
Finns beckon with electric pulse,  
while Aussies churn sweet siren swirls—  
symphonies veiled in playful guise.  
Midnight crowns a victor's thrill,  
yet it's the whispers that linger still.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Ich komme!’ The smutty Eurovision songs that dodge the censors When the winner of this year’s Eurovision song contest is announced shortly before midnight next Saturday, it won’t be the first climax of the evening. “I’m coming / I’m coming,” a scantily clad Finn will announce in the chorus of her song. Australia’s male entrant will invite listeners to “sh-sh-shake me good” so they can get “a taste of the milkshake man”. And Malta’s submission". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Ich komme!’ The smutty Eurovision songs that dodge the censors When the winner of this year’s Eurovision song contest is announced shortly before midnight next Saturday, it won’t be the first climax of the evening. “I’m coming / I’m coming,” a scantily clad Finn will announce in the chorus of her song. Australia’s male entrant will invite listeners to “sh-sh-shake me good” so they can get “a taste of the milkshake man”. And Malta’s submission
